metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12085 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description:
Liblouis 3.6.0 has a stack-based Buffer Overflow in the function parseChars in compileTranslationTable.c, a different vulnerability than CVE-2018-11440.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12085` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

liblouis-bin - 2.6.4-2ubuntu0.4
liblouis-data - 2.6.4-2ubuntu0.4
liblouis9 - 2.6.4-2ubuntu0.4
python-louis - 2.6.4-2ubuntu0.4
python3-louis - 2.6.4-2ubuntu0.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: liblouis package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.6.4-2ubuntu0.4').
